alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Florence; Forest; Kewaunee; Langlade; Lincoln; Manitowoc; Marathon; Menominee; Northern Marinette County; Northern Oconto County; Oneida; Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Southern Marinette County; Southern Oconto County; Vilas; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 7:57PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW WILL CONTINUE THIS EVENING WITH BITTER COLD WIND CHILL READINGS OVERNIGHT... A strong clipper system brought wind gusts over 50 mph to portions of central, north-central and northeast Wisconsin earlier this evening in association with the arctic cold front. Scattered snow showers will gradually end this evening from west to east. Some of the snow showers will be capable of producing visibilities below one mile and produce a quick half inch to one inch of snow. Sustained west to northwest winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph will continue this evening. A few gusts over 50 mph are still possible through midnight. The combination of the strong winds, falling snow, or the snow from today will continue to create areas of blowing and drifting snow resulting in hazardous travel conditions. Road conditions may be slow to improve overnight due to the gusty winds and blowing and drifting snow. As temperatures fall overnight, chemicals that treat roads may not be as effective to remove the snow off the road. Motorist should use extra caution if traveling tonight as roads will remain snow covered and slippery. The gusty winds will make for difficult travel for high profile vehicles. Overnight, wind chill readings are expected to fall to around 15 below zero across the Fox Valley and lakeshore to 20 below to 30 below zero well north and west of the Fox Valley. Wind chill readings this low can cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 15 to 30 minutes.
